dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indifferently) There's a million birds here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that birch tree is a nest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interested) Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) Up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks through her binoculars. Walter stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER (cont'd) A little higher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points her binoculars up. Walter walks towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's little chicks! (turns to Walter) You want to see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him her binoculars. He looks through them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're starlings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continues looking) Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like starlings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're extremely aggressive birds. Plus, their habits are rather filthy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mother sure has her hands full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her back the binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER (cont'd) You always carry these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I go bird-watching. It's why I like coming here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a city park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd be surprised how many kinds of birds you'll see here. Last week I saw a purple martin. And the week before that, I saw a solitary vireo. That's rare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A solitary vireo. I like that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their sound is quite musical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does it sound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard to describe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER (cont'd) I'd love to hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) It's a bright sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes her eyes and pipes a little tune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRL (cont'd) Cheery! Cheerily! Cheery! Cheerily!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens her eyes, shyly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIRL (cont'd) Something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was terrific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should hear the bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You live around here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pause) Not too far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIRL(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: (She looks at him) Are you a bird-watcher too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? Nah. I'm more of a people watcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you watching me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) Not   at first. You would stare at the   tops of the trees so intently. Any   second I thought you would take off   and fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you come here often?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My daddy likes me home before dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to listen to your daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl runs off down the path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter watches after her. He stands alone in the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter rides the bus. Through many different neighborhood day passes into night. He stares beyond his reflection. O the following voice-over we cut between Walter's apartmen and Walter riding the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I followed a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter sits at his window, writing in his journal, fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I talked to a girl... I was near a girl... Jesus God! What did I want to happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus drives by a number of billboards, children's Gap ads...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's like Rosen said. Maybe I wanted nothing to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter pauses in the writing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out loud) Fucking Rosen! This isn't helping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a loud KNOCK at the door. Walter looks over in surprise. The KNOCK comes again. Walter quickly closes hi journal and puts it in a drawer. The KNOCK comes again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter goes to the door and opens it partially.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ergeant Lucas stands outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiya, Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter opens the door. Lucas enters. Walter slowly closes door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do for you, Sergeant Lucas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas signals a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter slowly sits. Lucas walks around the room. He pause

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUCAS (cont'd) Too much sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas points to the plant on the windowsill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your ivy. Too much direct sunlight. These plants don't like a lot of sun.      W

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They grow outside, don't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure they do. But outside they've got trees around them. The trees shade them from the sun. Of course, the plants enrich the soil around the trees. One of nature's symbiotic relationships.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You going to take me on a nature walk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be witty. (pause) Yesterday you took the number twelve bus from work, but instead of getting off at your normal stop, for some reason you stayed on. Why did you stay on the bus, Walter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fell asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas throws him a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER (cont'd) When I woke up I was confused. I got off at the wrong stop and walked home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas looks at the bus map on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You walked home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas spits his gum into the garbage can and sits down ac from Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of these guys... They walk right into a family's home as if they live there. Very fucking ballsy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUCAS (cont'd) This one guy on death row, who I'll call Henry, told me about his last victim. Henry says how he's in the bedroom of a seven-year-old cutie named Adele. Her mother's in the living room watching TV. She's got the volume on so damn high he can hear David Letterman's jokes. Henry puts his hand over Adele's mouth and says, "If you scream, little girl, I'll kill your mother." And of course little Adele doesn't scream, doesn't cry, doesn't make a sound. Then he takes her hand and out they go through the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pause) Ten days later they find Adele's body. Or what's left of it. (looks at Walter) You believe in fairy tales?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fairy tales?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you believe in them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither do I. (pause) What's the one with the woodsman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woodsman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one with the ax?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you do. He cuts open the wolf's stomach, and the girl steps out alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little Red Riding Hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. Little Red Riding Hood jumps out of the wolf's guts with hardly a scratch. (pause) Ever see a seven-year-old girl sodomized almost in half?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUCAS (cont'd) She looked so small and broken. I saw hardened twenty-year veterans cry. They cried like babies. I was there. Ain't no fucking woodsman in this world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas takes out a fresh piece of gum and pops it in his mouth. Then he rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas stares coldly at Walter, his face red. He looks dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seething) I don't know why they keep letting scum like you return to the streets. It just means we've got to catch you all over again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slaps Walter on the back of the head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUCAS (cont'd) See ya, Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter rushes to the blinds, drawing them down, then scrambles to get his journal from the drawer. He drops to knees, tearing the pages from his journal, tearing them t bits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no right to talk to... to speak like... I am not!... I am not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND of children fades in, and Walter looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the bedroom doorway is the girl in her white nightgown sitting on the red ball, rocking back and forth, her chin her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wallie, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter squeezes his eyes shut and clamps his hands over h ears. The sound abruptly stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter rides the bus. He is unshaven and looks exhausted. is jostled by the crowds but seems oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Walter walks into the warehouse, men step out of the w and give him leering looks. Walter walks into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the locker room. A hush suddenly falls over the room. Walter looks around. No one will meet his eyes. He opens locker and a piece of paper slides out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a Xerox of the police notification information of Walter printed from the Internet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter stares at the paper. Suddenly something slams next his head. A piece of metal clangs to the floor. Walter tu around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: edro stares at him, surrounded by a number of men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicki stands in front of her locker holding the flyer. Sh looks scared. She glances at the men then walks over to Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet) Come on, let's get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me you feel sorry for this sick fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind your own business, Pedro!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicki looks defiantly at the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob hurries in, followed by a worker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on here?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's handed a flyer. He looks it over and turns red. He l at Walter then the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OB (cont'd) Who did this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary-Kay stands quietly in the back of the room, a look o satisfaction on her face. Vicki looks at her. Mary-Kay tu and sees Vicki's glare. She quickly looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one answers. Bob looks at the men for a long moment th at Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOB (cont'd) Any man who can't deal with it can see me in my office. I'll pay you for a week, and you can clear out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob crumples the paper in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOB (cont'd) We've got a hell of a lot of orders today. Get to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he men are stunned. Three angrily follow after Bob. As do Mary-Kay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter walks off without saying anything, his expression blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter works at his station. He pauses, staring at the cutting blade whirling before him. He looks up around him After a long moment, he turns the machine off and walks a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicki looks up from where she is working and notices Walt place is empty. She looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicki enters. Mary-Kay sits at her desk, typing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen Walter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (big fake smile) Lovers' quarrel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicki picks up Mary-Kay's mug and pours coffee on her lap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary-Kay shrieks and stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicki tears through Mary-Kay's drawers throwing contents the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARY-KAY (cont'd) What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: icki pulls out a handful of the notification fliers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People have the right to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she's here tomorrow, I'll fucking kill her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicki throws the papers at Bob and storms out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob looks at Mary-Kay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicki quickly crosses the parking lot to her Jeep, puttin her coat on as she goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter rides the bus, watching the landscape go by, his expression stony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicki pulls her Jeep into the parking lot and screeches t stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She races up the stairs and knocks on Walter's door. No answer. She knocks again. No answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She disappears back down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens. Vicki enters and turns to the superintend standing in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks again. I promised I'd take care of his plants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The super shrugs and heads back down the stairs. Vicki cl the door and turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is a mess, the blinds drawn. She turns on the lights. There is no sign of Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees the journal scattered on the floor and leafs thr the pieces. The image of the girl with red marker is stuc inside.                   V

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICKI (cont'd) Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up a couple pieces of paper and scans them, the she puts the pieces together. Walter's words are scrawled across the paper. Her hands start to shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus pulls to a stop. Walter gets off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter walks down park path. A jogger runs by, but otherw it is quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicki frantically gathers pieces of the journal and stuff them in a plastic bag. Her face is flushed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he stands up and stuffs the bag in the garbage then pause staring at the garbage can. She opens the can, grabs the quickly looks around the apartment. There is the sound of school bell outside. She rushes to the window and raises blinds. Children pour out of the school. She quickly leav

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter sits on a park bench in the same little field wher had encountered the girl before. He is alone. He sits sti He looks up at the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicki drives, the bag on the passenger seat. She comes to stop light and looks in the rear view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cop car pulls up behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: icki reaches over for the bag and stuffs it under the sea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light turns green. Vicki drives slowly. The cop chang lanes and passes her. She lets out her breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicki slowly drives by a series of parks, schools, malls searching.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Children abound, playing, running free, getting off of sc buses, running to meet their parents. There is no sign of Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl walks into the clearing, wearing her binoculars around her neck. She stops when she sees Walter sitting o the bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter continues staring at the trees. She walks over to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See anything interesting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl sits on the bench and pulls a small book from he backpack. She starts writing in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter watches her.          W

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER (cont'd) What are you writing in that book?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my bird book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shows it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIRL (cont'd) I've identified sixty-seven species of birds this year alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl writes in her book. Walter watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are your friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues writing ignoring his question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER (cont'd) Don't you have friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pretty girl like you should have a lot of friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... not in the common way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means uncommon beauty is commonly overlooked. Most people only notice birds with the brightest colors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl sits silently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER (cont'd) What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up her binoculars and peers through them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER (cont'd) Linda... Susan... Jennifer... Jackie..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues looking, but she smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER (cont'd) You tell me your name, I'll tell you mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) Robin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, like the bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) Can I ask how old you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm twelve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will be in three months. (pause) I can't wait. I hate being eleven. It has to be the stupidest age in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBIN (cont'd) What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter hesitates then shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have many friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long time ago, I was sent far away. When they let me come back, all my friends were gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds like you were banished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banished... yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Birds are my friends. That sounds egotistical, but they are. Birds know I watch them, but they don't mind because they like being watched... if they know you won't hurt them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to sit on my lap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to sit on my lap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) No thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure. Thank you all the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay... doesn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) Do you want me to sit on your lap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I would enjoy that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin shivers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER (cont'd) Are you cold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head. Walter slides closer and rubs her ar with his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER (cont'd) You look cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER (cont'd) I know a place in the park where only very small birds go. There are no people or dogs or ugly crows and pigeons. It's quiet except for the song of these tiny sparrowlike birds. Would you like me to take you there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) They sound like finches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They could be finches. I don't know. We should go before it gets dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER (cont'd) Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My daddy lets me sit on his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like it when he asks you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her answer has a strange effect on Walter, as if for a mo he has lost his balance. Carefully, he sits down and star at his hands.             W

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER (cont'd) Are you two alone when he asks you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER (cont'd) Does he touch you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin looks through her binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER (cont'd) Does he say strange things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She scans the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER (cont'd) Does he move his legs in a funny way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin drops her head and quietly sobs. Walter looks at he but makes no effort to comfort her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER (cont'd) Have you told your mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER (cont'd) Is there anyone at home you can talk to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER (cont'd) Is there a teacher you like at school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER (cont'd) What's her name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Kramer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell Ms. Kramer what your daddy does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you can, Robin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin in silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER (cont'd) You said you couldn't make the sound of a solitary vireo. But you did. Beautifully. I heard you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will happen if I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone will talk to your daddy. And then he'll stop doing those things... the things you don't like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears come to Robin's eyes again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But will he... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your daddy will always love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know because... it's just something I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to hurt my daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin, listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him. Walter struggles to find the words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER (cont'd) At first he'll be upset... very upset. It's because he'll realize he's been a bad daddy. Then he'll try... He'll try very hard to be a good daddy... People will say stupid, ignorant things about your daddy. That will be hard for you... But one thing I know for sure, he'll always love you... always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a long moment of silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you still want me to sit on your lap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBIN (cont'd) I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter slides away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't I stay a little longer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's getting dark. Go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will I see you again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go home, Robin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin gets up, goes over to Walter, and hugs him. Walter starts to put his arms around her but refrains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs off. Walter looks out, numb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter approaches his building. The white Volvo sits park across the street in front of the school. Walter walks a couple of more steps when the door to the Volvo opens. Wa freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candy gets out of the car. As he turns, Walter no longer Candy but himself -- many years younger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter watches, fear and emotion coursing through his fac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Walter leans back in and pulls the front seat forwa and a young girl emerges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash to the angel-faced boy getting out of the car. Cand pats him on the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter sees young Walter pat the girl on the head. She ru off down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter races towards Candy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candy tucks his shirt in, puts the seat back, and is abou get in the car when Walter calls out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candy whirls around. Walter smashes him in the face. Cand reels backwards hitting the car. Walter attacks Candy ful force. As he punches flashes of young Walter appear, then Candy, then young Walter again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pounds and pounds on Candy then finally pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candy sputters on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter, breathing hard, stares at Candy. He looks at the blood on his hands, which shake uncontrollably. He slowly stands up and starts to back away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candy rolls over and groans as he tries to raise himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter turns, tucks his head down, and quickly walks away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter stands in the living room. He looks down at the fl where the journal was and sees that nothing is there. He to his windows and lowers the blinds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the window we see Vicki sitting on her couch, bit her nail, staring off into space. The phone sits next to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter stands in the shower. He turns the water on and le it run over him. Slowly, he begins to sob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter stands at the bureau, cleaned up and dressed in fr clothes. He looks up and stares at himself in the mirror. sound of TRAFFIC fades in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter walks down a city street with boarded up store fro The sidewalks are wet from a steady drizzle. Cars pass by the wet pavement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Walter walks, we intercut with a SERIES OF FLASHBACKS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A) EXT. SCHOOL - Walter looks at the blood on his hands t at Candy moaning on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B) EXT. PARK - Robin stands in the middle of the field, binoculars held to her eyes, scanning the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ) EXTREME CLOSE-UP: Robin lowers the binoculars and stare us straight in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter stands at an intersection. The lights play across face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ) EXT. COP CAR - NIGHT - Walter's face slams against a co car. His hands are cuffed behind him, and he is roughly frisked. He tries to look back over his shoulder but his is held down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: E) EXT. PARK - Robin dances in circles in the fields, arm stretched out as if she is ready to fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car races by, and Walter walks along a busy street fast The rain falls harder now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ) EXT. HOUSE - NIGHT - Walter gets place in the back of t cop car. The cops get in the front seat. Walter looks out window at his house as the car pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing on the front steps, his wife turns away, carryin his daughter inside. A cop closes the door behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: G) EXT. SCHOOL - Walter pounds and pounds on Candy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter crosses an old brick bridge that spans a river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ) EXT. PARK - Robin twirls and twirls, then slowly dissol into the girl with the red ball and white nightgown. The spins and spins, her dress fluttering in the wind. Slowly girl fades away so the field is empty, except for a numbe small birds fluttering around the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter stands outside Vicki's door. After a moment he kno The door opens to show Vicki. She stares at Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the window we see Vicki sit down on the couch, an Walter sit on the coffee table, facing her. He starts to and takes her hand. She pulls it away. He continues to ta and takes her hand again, not letting her pull away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trucks pass by over the wet pavement, rattling the window

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The school is quiet, the playground empty. Swings sway listlessly in the breeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old Chevy pulls into the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter brings his duffel bag into his living room and set down next to a clothes hamper. Boxes are scattered about space. There's a KNOCK on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and Lucas enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter pauses.                L

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi ya, Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter automatically sits down in the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do for you, Sergeant Lucas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas walks over to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be asking the questions. (pause) Last night, you hear anything unusual? Screams? Shouts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: man was badly beaten across the street. You know anything about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) I didn't say what time the assault occurred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said last night. I went to bed pretty early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The assault took place at approximately seven thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went to bed around seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas gives him a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER (cont'd) I wasn't feeling well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could take you downtown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could. It'd be a waste of your time, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter starts folding his clothes and placing them in the duffle bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a boy there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is silent. Lucas watches him closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUCAS (cont'd) He I.D.'d the assailant. The description matches you pretty well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose if you're looking for a male between the ages of thirty and fifty, medium height, medium weight, medium build. Probably not too many men fit that bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give me a straight answer, Walter, cause the irony goes right over my head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas walks around. Walter folds a shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUCAS (cont'd) That's a nasty scratch on your neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a passionate girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with the boxes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a cop. Figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd say you're moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a free country, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas throws him a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER (cont'd) Just kidding. I'm moving in with my girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas raises his brows then takes out a piece of gum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The passionate one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'd say you're a lucky fellow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I count my blessings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess I'll be seeing you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas pops the gum in his mouth and heads towards the doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter pauses in his folding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think you'll catch this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. We'll catch him. Unfortunately, the victim can't talk. In addition to his other injuries, his jaw is broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUCAS (cont'd) However, we ran an I.D. on the victim. Turns out he's wanted in Pennsylvania. He raped a boy there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas watches Walter who impassively unrolls and rolls th same pair of socks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUCAS (cont'd) You sure you don't know nothing about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Fraid not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas looks at Walter for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay out of trouble, Walter. Cause I'll be watching you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter realizes he unrolled the socks. He tosses them in duffel bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicki drives. Walter stares out the passenger window. The is low on the horizon. Walter wears a pressed button-down shirt. He is clean-shaven and his hair neatly combed. His hand fidgets in his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking liar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicki reaches for his hand, then something catches her ey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICKI (cont'd) Hey, look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter follows her gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICKI (cont'd) Starlings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: n the horizon, a flock of starlings whirl and turn as if huge body, a dancing cloud against the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard they were filthy birds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not when they fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicki looks at him and smiles. There is a long beat as th drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicki sits in her car smoking. She stubs out her cigarett The ashtray is full. She looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: icki's POV: Walter and a woman stand in the distance near the water. The woman looks a few years younger than Walte There is space between them. Walter faces her, but she lo out at the water. After a long moment, he reaches to touc her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman pulls away and yells something at him. Walter's head drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: icki lights another cigarette. She flips on the radio to country music, blocking out all sound. She looks back out window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman yells angrily then falls quiet -- staring at Walter. After a long moment, she turns and walks back up hill to her car where Carlos waits, leaning against the c Annette gets in the car, slamming the door. Carlos pauses looking at Walter, then gets in the car and turns on the engine to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter stays standing near the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw my sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter sits in his usual seat across from Rosen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosen is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER (cont'd) She's still really hurt... and angry. I don't know... if she will ever... forgive me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: I understand that. I do. I just hope... I just want her to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Accept you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROSEN (cont'd) It's going to take time, Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you feel about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel... okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter looks at Rosen who nods. There is a moment of sile between them.
